comments.author: msftclas
comments.body:
Hi **@SteveL-MSFT**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution!

It looks like you're a Microsoft contributor (Steve Lee (POWERSHELL)). If you're full-time, we DON'T require a Contribution License Agreement. If you are a vendor, please DO sign the electronic Contribution License Agreement. It will take 2 minutes and there's no faxing! https://cla.microsoft.com.

TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-maintainers not sure how to fix this, travis ci job is trying to clone 1812 branch from PS/PS, but the PR is from SteveL-Msft/PS

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
> git clone -q --branch=1812 https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell.git C:\projects\powershell

Weird, the successful [AppVeyor build](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/6.0.0-alpha.12-1182) also cloned the remote branch 1812 from PS/PS and was successful ... Can you close this PR and send out another to see if that corrects it?

BTW, can you please create a more descriptive title for the PR (and message of the commit) when you re-send it? It's encouraged to have meaningful titles for all PRs.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @daxian-dbw I had a more descriptive one the first time I submitted this, then closed this and created a new one, but it reused this probably because it's the same commit.
